ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Re: ACID REST-HTTP
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Agree. Does the SOAP head do better than name/value pairs? Also, embedding another XML into SOAP body seems awkward as well. Hao

--- Berend de Boer <berend@...> wrote:
> >>>>> "S" == S Alexander Jacobson <alex@...>
> writes:
> 
>     S> Its nice that they defined a protocol for
> these things on top
>     S> of SOAP, but is there any reason to believe
> that if they had
>     S> put this design effort into doing it on top
> of HTTP/SMTP (and
>     S> perhaps RESTfully), we would not have these
> services without
>     S> the SOAP horror?
> 
> Maybe. Or would we have ended with a lot of HTTP
> horror? I don't
> know. The world's data doesn't neatly fit in
> name/value pairs.
> 
> 

Agree. Does the SOAP head do better than name/value
pairs? Also, embedding another XML into SOAP body
seems awkward as well. 

Hao
